com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.viewstate

Class MvpViewStateActivity<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • AppCompatActivity
      • com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.MvpActivity<V,P>
        • com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.viewstate.MvpViewStateActivity<V,P>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActivityMvpDelegateCallback<V,P>, ActivityMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V,P>, BaseMvpDelegateCallback<V,P>, BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V,P>, MvpView

    public abstract class MvpViewStateActivity<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
extends MvpActivity<V,P>
implements ActivityMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V,P>
    This is a enhancement of MvpActivity that introduces the support of RestorableViewState.

    You can change the behaviour of what to do if the viewstate is empty (usually if the activity creates the viewState for the very first time and therefore has no state / data to restore) by overriding BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback.onNewViewStateInstance()

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • getMvpDelegate

        protected ActivityMvpDelegate<V,P> getMvpDelegate()
        Description copied from class: MvpActivity
        Get the mvp delegate. This is internally used for creating presenter, attaching and detaching view from presenter.

        Please note that only one instance of mvp delegate should be used per Activity instance.

        Only override this method if you really know what you are doing.

        Overrides:
        getMvpDelegate in class MvpActivity<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Returns:
        ActivityMvpDelegateImpl

      • setRestoringViewState

        public void setRestoringViewState(boolean restoringViewState)
        Description copied from interface: BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback
        This method will be called by MvpViewStateInternalDelegate to inform that restoring the view state is in progress.
        Specified by:
        setRestoringViewState in interface BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Parameters:
        restoringViewState - true, if restoring viewstate is in progress, otherwise false

      • isRestoringViewState

        public boolean isRestoringViewState()
        Specified by:
        isRestoringViewState in interface BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Returns:
        true if the viewstate is restoring right now (not finished yet). Otherwise false.

      • onViewStateInstanceRestored

        public void onViewStateInstanceRestored(boolean instanceStateRetained)
        Description copied from interface: BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback
        Called if the ViewState instance has been restored successfully.

        In this method you have to restore the viewstate by reading the view state properties and setup the view to be on the same state as before.

        Specified by:
        onViewStateInstanceRestored in interface BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Parameters:
        instanceStateRetained - true, if the viewstate has been retained by usingFragment#setRetainInstance(boolean), otherwise false (always false for activities).

        Creates the ViewState instance
